IncidentNoteREST Resource

Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/comments

Gets all of the top-level comments for the incident.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentDTO (JSON) Returns a list of incident comments.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/comments/query

Gets a filtered list of all incident and task comments for the specified incident.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
inc_id path The incident ID.   int
org_id path The organization ID.   int
include_tasks query Specifies whether to include task comments. true boolean
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json QueryFilterDTO (JSON) Object containing the filters to query. A null object or an empty set of conditions will return all objects. Currently we support query filters on the following fields: text, user_id, and create_date.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentResultsDTO (JSON) Results of the query. Will be truncated to the server maximum, default = 1000 hits. Note that each hit will include its surrounding comment tree, so the number of root comments will not necessarily be equal to the limit.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/comments/{comment_id}

Gets an individual comment object.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.

text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
comment_id path The comment ID. int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition

400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentDTO (JSON) The requested incident comment.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/comments/{id}

Updates an incident comment.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The comment ID to update. int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentDTO (JSON) The comment data.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentDTO (JSON) Echos back the incident comment object.

DELETE /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/comments/{id}

Deletes an incident comment. Note that deleting a comment that is a parent of another comment will cause it to get marked as deleted and it's text will get blanked out, but the object will still exist to maintain the comment hierarchy. If you want to completely delete a parent comment, you must delete all it's children first.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The ID of the comment to delete. int
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json CommentDTO (JSON) Echos the comment.
